column4: hi, i can not execute a shell script as sudo in rc.local at startup, is there any way i can do that?
rc.local is owned by root, so any commands defined in there will run with that priveledge
just omit any sudos from the script
your system already has an X server running, you will need to make a virtual X server to run off of somehow (ive heard of it done buy i've not done it)
